timeline.bodyText:
why start with -1?
Also in terms of functionality, do not allow deleting the last line/last col (TB has at least one cell, add in precondition of remove line/col that num lines and cols > 1 to be able to delete.
timeline.author: georgiana-ecobici

replies.bodyText: I don't know what happens. At some point it adds 1, so I have to start from -1 to number them correctly.
replies.author: Cosmin-Visan

timeline.bodyText:
this function works only for Element TB. For diagram TB is not used?
rename the function to a more suggestive name: getTitleBlockNumColumns maybe and support also the Diagram TB type.
timeline.author: georgiana-ecobici

replies.bodyText: This is because you cannot add lines or columns to diagram title block.
replies.author: Cosmin-Visan

replies.bodyText: Renamed.
replies.author: Cosmin-Visan

timeline.bodyText: rename to a more suggestive name: getTitleBlockNumLines maybe
timeline.author: georgiana-ecobici

replies.bodyText: Renamed.
replies.author: Cosmin-Visan

timeline.bodyText: only constans in upper case. rename this variable, cammel case. (eAnnotationPresent)
timeline.author: georgiana-ecobici

replies.bodyText: Renamed.
replies.author: Cosmin-Visan

timeline.bodyText: This is not the condition to determine if it's a diagram or not. For diagram title block, the container must be the diagram. For element title block, the container must be an EdgeTarget.
timeline.author: minhtutonthat

replies.bodyText: This is just a precondition when hovering the mouse over the diagram, such that when the mouse is not above the proper element the forbidden icon to be displayed. And when the mouse is hovered above the empty screen it returns DataPkgImpl, that's why I used this.
replies.author: Cosmin-Visan

replies.bodyText: I meant it should be generic, use DDiagram, EdgeTarget instead of DataPkgImpl.
replies.author: minhtutonthat

timeline.bodyText:
First, the name of the method is really misleading. The method checks whether the elementView has at least 1 title block attached to it. It should be something like hasElementTitleBlock
Second, if elementView is always DDiagramElement, its parent diagram can be obtained from it, no need to pass as parameter.
timeline.author: minhtutonthat

replies.bodyText: Done. Also changed name for isUniqueDiagramTitleBlock.
replies.author: Cosmin-Visan

timeline.bodyText: why DNodeList?
timeline.author: minhtutonthat

replies.bodyText: In next Malina's commit she fixed it, added DDiagramElement I think.
replies.author: georgiana-ecobici

timeline.bodyText: why DNodeList?
timeline.author: minhtutonthat

replies.bodyText: Also Malina fixed it.
replies.author: Cosmin-Visan

timeline.bodyText: if you wanna say the target is not a TitleBlock, you must check the source of the DAnnotation. And why not create a helper to check whether a DAnnotation/a diagram element is a TitleBlock?
timeline.author: minhtutonthat

replies.bodyText: I'm not sure I understand. If it is not a TitleBlock then it also doesn't have a source, so how can that check be done ?
replies.author: Cosmin-Visan

replies.bodyText: A Tilte Block is a DAnnotation but a DAnnotation is not necessarily a Title Block. A DAnnotation has a source, this information is used to check if it's a Title Block or not, right?
replies.author: minhtutonthat

timeline.bodyText: Why IS_ELEMENT_TITLE_BLOCK is repeated in annotationCol and annotation itself?
timeline.author: minhtutonthat

replies.bodyText: Because when you add a line or a column you can click on either the cell or the parentTitleBlock.
replies.author: Cosmin-Visan

timeline.bodyText: Does the method mean "I do not have any attached diagram title block"?
timeline.author: minhtutonthat

replies.bodyText: Changed name to hasDiagramTitleBlock.
replies.author: Cosmin-Visan

timeline.bodyText: How can this happen?
timeline.author: minhtutonthat

replies.bodyText: Removed.
replies.author: Cosmin-Visan

timeline.bodyText: Could you use/complete the helper org.polarsys.capella.core.diagram.helpers.DAnnotationHelper to code things related to DAnnotation?
timeline.author: minhtutonthat

replies.bodyText: Moved this method to DAnnotationHelper.
replies.author: Cosmin-Visan

timeline.bodyText: Could you use helper methods? Like this, it's really hard to follow. For example: getAllTitleBlockFromDiagram, getAllTitleBlockLineFromTilteBlock, etc.
timeline.author: minhtutonthat

timeline.bodyText: Really, either you put comments to explain more or you break the code down to more understandable methods, like this it's really hard to follow. For example, this could be something like: getAllTitleBlockLines. The code should not only work but also maintainable.
timeline.author: minhtutonthat

replies.bodyText: Renamed to renumberCells and added comment.
replies.author: Cosmin-Visan

timeline.bodyText: I do not understand the name of this method.
timeline.author: minhtutonthat

replies.bodyText: Renamed to checkIsTitleBlock.
replies.author: Cosmin-Visan

timeline.bodyText: Similarly, this code is not maintainable. It must be something like deleteAllCells and then deleteAllLine, right?
timeline.author: minhtutonthat

replies.bodyText: Renamed to removeLine. Also method clearColumnEAnnotation renamed to removeColumn.
replies.author: Cosmin-Visan

timeline.bodyText:
There are important points to this approach:

Do we need to temporary TB_CONTENT annotation to store the result of the queries? Could you try to use the TitleBlockCell itself as the domain object of the node and inteprete the content on the fly?
Not only Strings are stored in these DT_TitleBlockCellNode. We have to support the query that returns a list of object. For example: feature:ownedPropertyValues. This is the basic use case and must be implemented.
timeline.author: minhtutonthat

replies.bodyText: Implemented.
replies.author: Cosmin-Visan

replies.bodyText: TB_CONTENT shall hold the query (aql:, feature:, capella:), the result is interpreted on the fly.
replies.author: georgiana-ecobici

timeline.bodyText: For Show/Hide part, why do we need to use the attribute VISIBILITY to verify that a title block is visible or not? In other diagrams, we do not need this attribute to do Show/Hide.
timeline.author: minhtutonthat
